row.item_desc: <h3>Textblock</h3> <p>Here is a <strong>textblock</strong> with HTML in it. You can use this space to transition to the next section or subsection within a tab on the <em>Theme Options</em> page. It's use is strictly for the admin UI and is not for the front-end of the web site.</p>
You can save a simple string here. Maybe a link to feedburner or your Twitter username.
You could ask a question with a checkbox. For example, do you want to activate asynchronous Google analytics?
You could ask a question with a radio input. For example, do you want to activate asynchronous Google analytics?
Use this to list different theme styles or choose some other important setting.
Here users can add custom code or text for use in your theme.

Here you can upload any WordPress supported media. After uploading, hit the "Insert into Post" button. One caveat of this feature is that if you upload media on one site the URL will no be correct if you import the data to a new one. You'll have to re-upload the media.
This is a very self explanatory feature. Use it to change the color of something.
Choose from a list of categories and save as a single category ID for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of categories and save multiple category ID's for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of tags and save as a single tag ID for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of tags and save as multiple tag ID's for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of posts and save as a single post ID for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of posts and save as multiple post ID's for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of pages and save as a single page ID for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of pages and save as multiple page ID's for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of any post type and save as a single ID for use in a function or loop.
Choose from a list of any post type and save as multiple ID's for use in a function or loop.
